raw_response: {"answer_index": 0, "answer_text": "B.", "confidence": 10, "reasoning": "Germinal centers are specialized structures within secondary lymphoid organs where B lymphocytes (B cells) proliferate, differentiate, and undergo somatic hypermutation and class switching. T helper (Th) cells assist in this process, but the primary proliferating cells in germinal centers are B cells, not cytotoxic T cells (Tc), NK cells, or Th cells themselves."}
